contentrichtext.text: '''Gloria RodrÃ­guez''', better known by her [[stage name]] '''Hurricane G''', is an American [[rapping|rapper]] of [[Puerto Rican people|Puerto Rican]] descent. Her 1997 single release "Somebody Else" charted at #10 by Billboard Magazine on [[Hot Rap Singles]],<ref>{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p224773|pure_url=yes}}</ref> and at #54 on their [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Singles & Tracks]] chart.<ref>{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=hurricane g|chart=all}}</ref> She was born in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Henderson|first=Alex|title=Hurricane G > Biography|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p224773|pure_url=yes}}|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|accessdate=July 20, 2010}}</ref> She was the [[Hit Squad]]'s first female member, and made guest appearances on albums by [[Keith Murray (rap)|Keith Murray]], [[Redman (rapper)|Redman]], [[Xzibit]], [[Delinquent Habits]], [[Funkdoobiest]], the [[Cocoa Brovaz]], and others. She also appeared on [[Puff Daddy]]'s track "P.E. 2000". Her much-delayed debut [[album]], ''[[All Woman (album)|All Woman]]'', was released in 1997. Hurricane G has a daughter by [[Erick Sermon]] (of [[EPMD]] fame) named Lexus. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== * ''[[All Woman (album)|All Woman]]'' (1997) * ''[[Mami & Papi (album)|Mami & Papi]]'' with [[Thirstin Howl III]] (2013) ===Singles=== *"Padre Nuestro (Our Father)" on ''[[Red Hot + Latin: Silencio = Muerte]]'' * "Somebody Else" * 2004 feature from the [[Tony Touch]] album ''The Reggaetony Album'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p224773|pure_url=yes}} Hurricane G at Allmusic.com] *{{MySpace|hurricaneglamadrina|Hurricane G}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = G, Hurricane | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American rapper | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:G, Hurricane}} [[Category:American people of Puerto Rican descent]] [[Category:Female rappers]] [[Category:People from Brooklyn]] [[Category:Rappers from New York]] [[Category:Living people]]
